EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
 • Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) equipped with burner‑inserters and output chests.
 • Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) similarly configured.
 Use-case: Automates the smelting of raw materials.

Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
 • Burner‑Mining Drill at Position(x=-15.0, y=-50.0) connected to a wooden chest at Position(x=-13.5, y=-51.5), with transport belts linking extraction to storage.
 Use-case: Enables continuous extraction and transfer of iron ore.

Automation Research Lab
 • Laboratory unit(s) receiving automation‑science‑pack inputs and supported by a network of small electric poles (as indicated by electrical identifiers in lab entities).
 Use-case: Advances research and technology in automation.

Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
 • Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) featuring connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5) with a steam output at Position(x=6.5, y=20.5).
 • Offshore Pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5) providing water supply.
 • Pre‑existing Steam Engines located at:
  – Position(x=0.5, y=9.5)
  – Position(x=18.5, y=11.5)
  – Position(x=1.5, y=13.5)
  – Position(x=13.5, y=14.5)
  – Position(x=19.5, y=14.5)
  – Position(x=22.5, y=18.5)
 • Extra Steam Engine intended for integration at approximately Position(x=12.5, y=21.5) remains unplaced.
 Use-case: Generates electrical power via steam produced from heated water.

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
Extra Steam Engine Placement Failures
 • The extra steam engine consistently fails to be placed due to severe congestion around the boiler at Position(8.0, 20.5); the targeted buildable area near (approximately 8.5, 22.5) is fully obstructed.
 • Obstructions include misaligned burner‑inserters, overlapping transport belts, and other interfering entities.
 • Mitigation Strategies:
  – Perform a meticulous manual inspection of the area around the boiler and its connection regions.
  – Remove or reposition all interfering entities to clear a viable build area.
  – Consider relocating the extra steam engine further from the congested zone or adjusting the boiler layout to create ample open space for proper machine placement.
